text: I was thinking about Kakoune. I use vs code now, and am pretty addicted to the option+enter hotkey, which execute code in blocks which is separated by dubble number signs (##). Is there a similar feature in a kakoune/tmux setup, that can copy a code block and send it to a repl window/pane?

text: Yes you can even do this in vim with slime-tmux but a lot of people complain about it that it doesn’t work properly. As of now I haven’t experienced that kakoune is failing. It has native support for tmux repl windows. You can start from within kakoune new tmux repl windows and bind the send-text command

text:
> Is there a similar feature in a kakoune/tmux setup, that can copy a code block and send it to a repl window/pane?
I wrote a <https://github.com/mroavi/vim-julia-cell|plugin> that does this for (n)vim. It uses slime underneath. The difference is that instead of printing the code sent in the REPL, it uses `include_string(Main, clipboard())` to receive it (which is nice for large cells or when sending the entire script).

" Slime (Vim) {{{
 "let g:slime_preserve_curpos = 0
   "let g:slime_target = "vimterminal"
   let g:slime_target = "tmux"
   let g:slime_no_mappings = 1
   xmap <leader>s <Plug>SlimeRegionSend
   nmap <leader>s <Plug>SlimeMotionSend
   nmap <Space> <Plug>SlimeLineSend
   "nnoremap <Space> <Plug>SlimeSend1
" }}}
